JavaScriptReferenceOperatorsYield.summary: The yield operator is used to pause and resume a generator function.
JavaScriptReferenceOperatorsYield.returns:
Returns the optional value passed to the generator's next() method to resume its execution.
NOTENote: This means next() is asymmetric: it always sends a value to the currently suspended yield, but returns the operand of the next yield. The argument passed to the first next() call cannot be retrieved because there's no currently suspended yield.
